keyword.showAs: Cooperation between the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.

step.by: Belarus, China, India, Iran (Islamic Republic of), Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Russian Federation, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan

TLCTerm.showAs: Without reference to a main committee

p.inline: Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and other organizations: cooperation between the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization

p.docTitle: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 5 September 2025

docTitle.span: Cooperation between the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling that one of the objectives of the United Nations is to achieve cooperation in maintaining international peace and security and solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural or humanitarian character,

container.name: Recalling also
container.p: Recalling also the Articles of the Charter of the United Nations that encourage activities on the basis of regional cooperation to promote the goals and objectives of the United Nations,

container.name: Recalling further
container.p: Recalling further its resolution 59/48 of 2 December 2004, by which it granted observer status to the Shanghai Cooperation Organization,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling its resolutions 64/183 of 18 December 2009, 65/124 of 13 December 2010, 67/15 of 19 November 2012, 69/11 of 11 November 2014, 71/14 of 21 November 2016, 73/334 of 30 August 2019, 75/268 of 25 March 2021 and 77/338 of 1 September 2023 on cooperation between the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization,

container.name: Recalling also
container.p: Recalling also the Joint Declaration on Cooperation between the Secretariats of the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, dated 5 April 2010,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting that the Shanghai Cooperation Organization is committed to act consistently with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations,

container.name: Noting also
container.p: Noting also that the Shanghai Cooperation Organization has become an essential regional organization for addressing security in the region in all its dimensions, including in cooperation with relevant regional organizations,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p: Recognizing that interaction within the Shanghai Cooperation Organization can serve as a basis for forming an equal and indivisible security architecture in Eurasia, as affirmed in the Astana Declaration of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization of 4 July 2024,

container.name: Taking into account
container.p:
Taking into account the commitment of the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to pursue the implementation of the goals outlined in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development,
Resolution 70/1. and welcoming the decision of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to designate 2025 as the Year of Sustainable Development,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling the commitment of the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to achieve a pacific settlement of regional disputes under Chapter VIII of the Charter of the United Nations,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p:
Recognizing the efforts of the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, upholding the “Shanghai spirit”, to build the region of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization into a region of lasting peace, friendship, prosperity and harmony, in accordance with the Treaty on Long-term Good-neighbourliness, Friendship and Cooperation among the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization,
United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 2896, No. 50518.

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling that, in its resolution 77/338, it noted the aspiration of the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to promote stability and the maintenance of international peace and security, and noting in this regard the meetings of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, including the twenty-fourth meeting, held in Astana, Kazakhstan, on 4 July 2024,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the series of events held by the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to commemorate the eightieth anniversary of the founding of the United Nations and the eightieth anniversary of the victory of the Second World War,

container.name: Welcoming also
container.p:
Welcoming also the commitment of States Party to the Treaty on the Non‑Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons
Ibid., vol. 729, No. 10485. that are States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to comply fully with the Treaty, including in Central Asia, while reaffirming the inalienable right of States Party to the Treaty to develop research, production and use of nuclear energy for peaceful purposes without discrimination and in conformity with articles I and II of the Treaty,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p:
Recognizing the efforts of the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to promote counter-terrorism cooperation, including through the Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure, and welcoming in this regard the protocol on cooperation between the Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, signed on 22 July 2012, noting the cooperation between the Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the Office of Counter-Terrorism, including the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre, in implementing the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy,
Resolution 60/288. and the cooperation between the Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the Counter-Terrorism Committee Executive Directorate, and noting the Memorandum of Understanding on cooperation between these two entities signed on 25 March 2019,

container.name: Recognizing also
container.p:
Recognizing also the role of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in combating drugs, based on the outcome of the thirtieth special session of the General Assembly on the world drug problem, held in New York from 19 to 21 April 2016,
Resolution S-30/1, annex. and encouraging the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to continue such cooperation in this field,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime in June 2011 with a view to effectively addressing, in cooperation with relevant international and regional actors, the production of and trade and trafficking in drugs, and welcoming the further cooperation of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the Office,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting the improved quality of the dynamics of cooperation among the States members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, as well as the further enhancement of the potential and role of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in the international arena as a multilateral mechanism, and in this regard welcoming the convening of the meetings of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, including the twenty-first meeting, held in Dushanbe on 16 and 17 September 2021, the twenty-second meeting, held in Samarkand on 15 and 16 September 2022, the twenty-third meeting, held under the chairmanship of India on 4 July 2023 in video format, and the first meeting held in the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Plus format in Astana on 4 July 2024,

container.name: Taking note
container.p: Taking note of the initiatives of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, as well as the efforts of others, to address security of and in the use of information and communications technologies, and recognizing the need for further discussions in relevant forums,

container.name: Acknowledging
container.p:
Acknowledging the role of initiatives at the regional level in supporting sustainable development and the need to foster an open, fair and inclusive environment for development and cooperation worldwide, and in this regard recalling the initiative “On World Unity for a Just Peace, Harmony and Development”,
See A/79/807-S/2025/132. introduced by Kazakhstan during its chairmanship at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Plus summit, held in Astana on 4 July 2024, and endorsed by a decision of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, which the Shanghai Cooperation Organization members recognized as an important contribution to global efforts to advance the formation of a more representative, democratic, just and multipolar world order based on the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and international law, with the central coordinating role of the United Nations, and which advocates ensuring equal opportunities for the development of all States regardless of their geographical location, territorial size, demographic, military and resource potential, and political, economic and social structure,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the secretariat of the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific in September 2022 aimed at enhancing cooperation in trade, transport, energy, and information and communications technology connectivity,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding on cooperation between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization in September 2022 with the goal of strengthening peace, sustainable development and intercultural dialogue by means of developing cooperation in education, science, culture, communication and information,

container.name: Welcoming also
container.p: Welcoming also the signing in February 2024 of the Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the United Nations Environment Programme to develop collaboration on the preservation of biological diversity, adaptation to climate change and the mitigation of its consequences, the reduction of environmental pollution and the development of ecological tourism,

container.name: Welcoming further
container.p: Welcoming further the renewal in October 2024 of the Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations to continue cooperation on sustainable rural development, ensuring food security, and digital agriculture,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting the decision adopted on 4 July 2024 in Astana by the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to grant Belarus the status of a State member of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p:
Recognizing the efforts of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization to promote cooperation with other regional organizations, including the Collective Security Treaty Organization, the Commonwealth of Independent States, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, the Conference on Interaction and Confidence-building Measures in Asia, the Economic Cooperation Organization, the Eurasian Economic Union
The Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the Eurasian Economic Commission was signed in Dushanbe on 17 September 2021. and the League of Arab States,
The Memorandum of Understanding between the secretariat of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and the League of Arab States was signed in Samarkand on 16 September 2022. as well as with the International Committee of the Red Cross,

container.name: Taking into consideration
container.p: Taking into consideration the fact that countries with economies in transition are among the members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, and in this regard recalling its resolution 61/210 of 20 December 2006, in which it proposed that the United Nations system enhance dialogue with regional and subregional cooperation organizations whose membership includes countries with economies in transition and increase support provided to them,

container.name: Convinced
container.p: Convinced that strengthening cooperation between the United Nations and other organizations of the United Nations system and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization helps to promote the goals and objectives of the United Nations,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the final settlement of the territorial and State border issues achieved by Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan and by Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan, in full compliance with the norms of international law and the Charter of the United Nations and in the interests of maintenance of regional peace, stability and security, and recognizing the particular significance of the signed treaty as a valuable contribution to peace, security and stability within the Shanghai Cooperation Organization’s space,

container.name: Welcoming also
container.p: Welcoming also the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Tianjin Summit, held on 31 August and 1 September 2025 under the chairmanship of China, and the Tianjin Declaration of the Council of Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization,

container.name: Welcoming further
container.p: Welcoming further the assumption of the chairmanship by Kyrgyzstan for the 2025–2026 term,

content.p: Acknowledges the constructive role of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in securing peace and sustainable development, advancing regional cooperation and strengthening good-neighbourliness and mutual trust, and notes the activities of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization aimed at strengthening peace, security and stability in the region, countering terrorism, drug trafficking and other types of criminal activity of a transnational character and promoting regional cooperation in various areas such as trade and economic development, energy, transportation, agriculture and agro-industry, the regulation of migration, banking and finances, information and telecommunications, science and new technology, start-ups and innovation, the digital economy, customs, education, public health, traditional medicine, environmental protection and reducing the danger of natural disasters, as well as in other related areas;

Emphasizes the importance of strengthening dialogue, cooperation and coordination between the United Nations system and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, and proposes that the Secretary-General, for this purpose, continue to hold regular consultations with the Secretary-General of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization through the existing inter-agency forums and formats, including the high-level interactive dialogue of the Secretary-General of the United Nations with the heads of the regional organizations and other organizations;

Proposes that the specialized agencies, organizations, programmes and funds of the United Nations system cooperate with the Shanghai Cooperation Organization with a view to jointly implementing programmes to achieve their goals, and in this regard recommends that the heads of such entities continue consultations with the Secretary-General of the United Nations;
Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its eighty-first session a report on the implementation of the present resolution;

Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-first session, under the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and other organizations”, the sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization”.
